entry.title: The Unspoken Language of Us
entry.summary:
Author: Margottier

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,715Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 50

Summary: The idea, once it had taken root in Buck’s mind, refused to be dislodged. It had started as a simple, offhand conversation about a podcast Hen had been raving about, something about the five love languages. They’d been at the station, cleaning the truck, the scent of disinfectant and engine grease hanging in the air. Buck, always eager for a new system to understand the people he loved, had turned to Eddie and asked, “So, which do you think makes you feel most loved?” Eddie had stopped wiping down the hose connector, his body going still for a moment as he genuinely considered it. He thought for a long moment. Too long, maybe. Then he shrugged, a gesture that seemed to carry the weight of a lifetime of quiet disappointment. “Honestly, Buck? I have no idea.”

entry.title: Second Chances
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 355,070Chapters: 44/?Kudos: 59

Summary: Bobby and Athena are just two people trying to put their lives back together while figuring out how to co-parent. What starts as a complicated plan to foster kids in need slowly turns into something much deeper. Through the ups and downs of heartbreak, healing, and raising children who’ve been through so much, they find strength in each other. Over time, their partnership grows into love, and together, they build a story about family, trust, and second chances.

entry.title: Evergrowing
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 253,433Chapters: 41/?Kudos: 20

Summary: Athena and Bobby are learning that parenting doesn’t end when the kids turn eighteen. With three grown children and two still at home, Bobby and Athena find themselves navigating new challenges at every stage of life. Each child carries their own struggles, some spoken and some hidden, but together the family works through the ups and downs with love, patience, and resilience. At the heart of it all, they’re reminded that family is a bond that grows, shifts, and deepens, no matter how old the kids get.

entry.title: So Wrong...So Right
entry.summary:
Author: ReggietheChickenWhisperer

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,583Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 2

Summary: Rewritten starting at the competition scene with Tommy and Buck.Buck stands up for himself and Eddie against Tommy. Even though Buck has come a long way, he still struggles when he's alone, even more so once he breaks up with Tommy for a second time and is left alone in Eddie's house. But, even though standing up against Tommy felt so right, something will go so horribly wrong.Eddie is in Texas, has been for months. He finally has Chris again, which feels so right. But something is missing, something is wrong. He's stuck working as an Uber and seeing all his friends and family in LA through a phone screen.What will it take for things to finally be right for Buck and Eddie again?

entry.title: The Boy Next Door
entry.summary:
Author: buddiesongfic

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 10,000Chapters: 6/?Kudos: 20

Summary: Buck smiles, almost too warm. “God, you're handsome, you know that?” Eddie chuckled, even though a flicker of discomfort ran through him. “Handsome, loyal, great, sexy…” Buck’s voice trailed, soft but deliberate. Eddie stood up, reaching for his jacket, letting out a huffing laugh at the last word. But when he turned around… Buck was already close. “So sexy…” Buck hushed, his face just inches from Eddie’s. The words were soft, intimate, but the gaze—locked, lingering—made Eddie freeze. OR; the literal (Maybe not) story of the movie The Boy Next Door

entry.title: On Shift, So Smitten
entry.summary:
Author: buddiesongfic

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 437Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 45

Summary: “Hey!” Chim yells from the other side of the truck. “You two better not be making out back there!” Buck freezes. Eddie doesn’t even flinch—he just sighs and presses one more kiss to the corner of Buck’s mouth like he’s claiming interest. Then he steps back, tugging Buck’s jacket straight with stupid fondness in his eyes. “Let them talk,” Eddie says. “I’m kissing my boyfriend.” OR; A slice of life for Buck and Eddie Post-Canon (TIM MINEAR MAKE IT HAPPEN)

entry.title: i see trouble (and i want him to come my way)
entry.summary:
Author: neonweeknds

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 153,593Chapters: 17/24Kudos: 55

Summary: Buck was riding the high of his first successful solo debut, still nursing the ache of someone who walked away, when he got news that blindsided him—his upcoming solo tour wouldn’t be so solo after all. He’d be sharing the stage with Eddie Diaz, a rising country star with a mysterious past and a sound that was quickly blowing up. At first, Buck hated the idea. The last thing he wanted was to split the spotlight he’d fought so hard for. But then he actually got to know Eddie. The problem? Buck had always blurred the line between friendship and something more—and with Eddie, it was getting harder to tell the difference. or the pop star evan buckley and country singer eddie diaz slow burn angsty friends to lovers au.

entry.title: A Kiss; a Confession
entry.summary:
Author: amessofwords11

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,983Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 8

Summary: Six months. It had been six months since everything happened with Bobby. Since he... died. Buck still had trouble saying that part. In just six months, he moved into a new house, Eddie became Hen's partner on the job and Ravi, Buck's. Six months of grieving, baking, adjusting, and grieving some more. And then the worst part of all; Eddie had barely spoken to Buck. And Buck felt less than stellar about that fact. -- Or, I'm giving us what we deserve (Buddie) because the writers are cowards. I said it. Here's what SHOULD happen next, with lots of Maddie because she is the matchmaker.

entry.title: How To Lose a Firefighter In Ten Days Off
entry.summary:
Author: Buddie_Butterflies

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 34,632Chapters: 9/?Kudos: 48

Summary: He walks past them and sits at the bar to order a round of shots, figuring that coming into the group that way might be a good icebreaker. He hasn’t ordered yet when he hears behind him, “Thanks for the shot.” he turns to see Captain Diaz standing by him, and Buck is confused “You're talking to me, Captain Diaz.” Buck smiles, trying to assess the situation. “It’s Eddie, and yes, you're the only one to buy me a shot.” He tells him, and Buck smiles. “Really, no one brought you a drink? I am surprised,” Buck says honestly. “Why is that, Buck?” Eddie asks, leaning against the counter. Was this man actually flirting with him? “Have you looked in the mirror, Diaz. Does anyone call you that?" Buck leans in. “Not if they want me to answer.” Eddie takes a sip of his beer, and Buck can’t take his eyes off him. “I look in mirrors every day, your point?” he shrugs and stares back. “You do know how beautiful you are, right?” Buck lays the charm on thick. “Is your full name Eduardo?”     OR How To Lose A Guy in Ten Days: Firefight Edition- loosely based on it, these two are so in love with each other and can't admit it.

entry.title: Cell Block Tango
entry.summary:
Author: WellHelloHello

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,499Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 29

Summary: Buck climbed out of the ambulance and scrambled around the back to find Eddie also standing there, “Are you alright?” He asked, pulling her into a hug. In retrospect making the fact that they were in a relationship extremely obvious wasn’t a good idea, but they were both so worried about the other they didn’t think.She clung on tightly, not wanting to let go, “I’m fine. Are you?”“Yeah, yeah, I’m fine.”“Would you look at that, we got ourselves a pair of love birds.” The prisoner who’d been upfront chuckled, “Isn’t that ideal.”orWhilst transporting an injured prisoner to the hospital Buck and Eddie find out the man on the gurney might not be a convict and the guards might not be as innocent as they first thought.

entry.title: Dial Drunk
entry.summary:
Author: sleepypossum

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 90,031Chapters: 13/15Kudos: 170

Summary: Tommy breaks up with Buck and he is officially over the baking stage, so he is now back on his Buck 1.0 path, except every time he gets drunk he ends up at Eddie’s front door.Eddie is just trying to find ways to feel normal about Christopher being in Texas. When Buck keeps showing up to his door it makes a great distraction except for the fact that it is drudging up all kinds of unwanted feelings
